procedure.title: Managing &abbrev; from Puppet
procedure.para: To simplify the management of large-scale &abbrev; deployments, you can centrally manage your &abbrev; hosts from Puppet. The &product; Puppet module (syslog_ng) allows you to perform the following tasks.

listitem.para: Update the &abbrev; configuration file of your hosts from a central repository.
Create backup of your &abbrev; configuration files. You can redistribute these backups to your hosts if a rollback is needed.

procedure.para: The Puppet module supports the following platforms: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), Oracle Linux, CentOS, Ubuntu, and Debian. Other Linux platforms based on .deb and .rpm packages might also work, but are not tested.
To manage your &abbrev; clients from Puppet, complete the following steps.
To use the syslog_ng Puppet module, the following prerequisites must be met.

listitem.para: A Puppet architecture installed and configured
The Puppet master and slaves nodes are configured and connected
The filebucket feature of Puppet is enabled and configured
Package repositories are added to the slave nodes (where &abbrev; can be installed from)

step.para: Login to &mybalabit; and download the &abbrev; installer package for your platform.
Add the &abbrev; installer package to your local package repositories.
Download the syslog_ng Puppet module from the Balabit website.
Copy the module to your Puppet master, then build and install it. For details, see the Readme.md file of the module.
